TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi Manager extends System.Object implements class Microsoft.IE.IHostEx

summary.span: Provides methods for enabling managed code to execute as an ActiveX control.

span.span: Provides methods for enabling managed code to execute as an ActiveX control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A classe Manager inicializa as propriedades que permitem que o código gerenciado executar como um controle ActiveX em um domínio de aplicativo em área restrita.The Manager class initializes the properties that enable managed code to execute as an ActiveX control in a sandboxed application domain.

param.name: pURL
param.span: A null-terminated string of maximum length () that contains a URL string.

span.span: A null-terminated string of maximum length () that contains a URL string.

param.span: If the string does not refer to a file, it must include a valid scheme such as "http://".

span.span: If the string does not refer to a file, it must include a valid scheme such as "http://".

param.name: flags
param.span: The flags that specify how the URL will be converted to canonical form.

span.span: The flags that specify how the URL will be converted to canonical form.

param.span: The following flags can be combined:

span.span: The following flags can be combined:

param.span: - : Treat "/./" and "/../" in a URL string as literal characters, not as shorthand for navigation.

span.span: - : Treat "/./" and "/../" in a URL string as literal characters, not as shorthand for navigation.

param.span: - : Convert any occurrence of "%" to its escape sequence.

span.span: - : Convert any occurrence of "%" to its escape sequence.

param.span: - : Replace only spaces with escape sequences.

span.span: - : Replace only spaces with escape sequences.

param.span: This flag takes precedence over , but does not apply to opaque URLs.

span.span: This flag takes precedence over , but does not apply to opaque URLs.

param.span: - : Replace unsafe characters with their escape sequences.

span.span: - : Replace unsafe characters with their escape sequences.

param.span: Unsafe characters are characters that may be altered during transport across the Internet.

span.span: Unsafe characters are characters that may be altered during transport across the Internet.

param.span: They include the <, >, ", #, {, }, |, \\, ^, [, ], and ' characters.

span.span: They include the <, >, ", #, {, }, |, \\, ^, [, ], and ' characters.

param.span: This flag applies to all URLs, including opaque URLs.

span.span: This flag applies to all URLs, including opaque URLs.

param.span: - : Defined to be the same as .

span.span: - : Defined to be the same as .

param.span: - : Combine URLs with client-defined pluggable protocols, according to the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification.

span.span: - : Combine URLs with client-defined pluggable protocols, according to the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification.

param.span: This flag does not apply to standard protocols such as FTP, HTTP, and Gopher.

span.span: This flag does not apply to standard protocols such as FTP, HTTP, and Gopher.

param.span: If this flag is set, there is no need to also set .

span.span: If this flag is set, there is no need to also set .

param.span: - : Unescape any escape sequences that the URLs contain, with two exceptions.

span.span: - : Unescape any escape sequences that the URLs contain, with two exceptions.

param.span: The escape sequences for "?" and "#" are not unescaped.

span.span: The escape sequences for "?" and "#" are not unescaped.

param.span: If one of the URL_ESCAPE flags is also set, the two URLs are first unescaped, and then combined, and then escaped.

span.span: If one of the URL_ESCAPE flags is also set, the two URLs are first unescaped, and then combined, and then escaped.

span.span: Converts a URL string into canonical form.
